meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny -!

Alright, let's get this review party started! Horizon Chase 2 has been getting some serious praise from the critics, but I'm here to give you the lowdown on whether this game is worth your precious gaming time.

First off, I've got to agree with PlayStation Universe - this game is a phenomenal package for arcade racing game fans. The visuals are top-notch, and the gameplay is where it's at. It's like they took all the best parts of classic arcade racers and put 'em in a blender, then hit puree. Out comes this smooth, fast-paced, high-score-chasing goodness that'll keep you coming back for more.

Now, I know what you're thinkin', "What about the multiplayer?" Well, let me tell ya, Push Square's got it right - the online multiplayer is where it's at. You can play with friends or strangers, and the crossplay makes sure everyone's on the same page (or should I say, same track?). It's a blast racing against others, trying to beat their times and climb up those leaderboards.

But here's the thing, folks - this game's not gonna hold your attention for too long. You'll have fun with it for a bit, but then you'll probably move on to something else. That's okay, though! As GameSpew so eloquently puts it, "Bigger and better than its predecessor in every single way." Yeah, that's this game in a nutshell.

Now, I know some of y'all might be thinkin', "What about the criticisms?" Well, let me tell ya, Player 2's got some valid points - the progression system is kinda automated, and the audio mixing could use a little work. But honestly, these are just minor quibbles in an otherwise fantastic game.

So, what's the verdict? Horizon Chase 2 is a must-play for fans of arcade racing games. It's fast, it's fun, and it's full of nostalgia for those old-school racers. Trust me, you won't be disappointed!
